title: Gale.Encyclopedia of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity [101]
description:
NOTE: I UPLOADED THIS TORRENT LONG AGO (02/06/2008 3:40:51 by uTorrent/1770), BUT ALL MY TORRENTS WERE DELETED. I AM GRADUALLY REUPLOADING ALL OF THEM.

=============================================================

-Author: Dinah Shelton, Editor in chief. 

-Titles: 
Gale - Encyclopedia of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity - Vol I, [A- H]
Gale - Encyclopedia of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity - Vol II, [I- S]
Gale - Encyclopedia of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity - Vol III, [T- Z]

-Publishing House: Gale-Macmillan Library Reference. 2004

-Format: PDF 

-Pages: Over 1400 pages 

-Size: 124 MG. Seven files.

-Extras: I have created one by one all the bookmars for the three books, plus edited with Snagit other four separated covers in bigger sizes: around 500 x 685 pixels in bitmap (Vol. 3 has two cover versions) .


Description taken from Amazon UK:

Genocide: the systematic annihilation of a group of people for simply being who they are, whether in ethnic, religious or social terms. It has been with us since the beginning of history. The most widely-studied and catastrophic examples are, however, historically close: the Nazi Holocaust against the Jew, "ethnic cleansing" in Bosnia, and tribal warfare in Rwanda. Genocide is unfortunately a key feature of the study of world history at nearly every level. The Encyclopedia of Genocide and Crimes against Humanity spans the globe to explain the issues behind crimes against humanity and human rights issues as they relate to individual countries and the world at large. It traces the history of events that qualify as genocide and crimes against humanity, profiles perpetrators and heroes, and explains international laws and law proceedings aimed at ending genocide and crimes against humanity at specific groups or at least punishing those who have committed such crimes. It also delves into depictions and manifestations of the phenomenon, such as propaganda, sociological and philosophical explanations, literature, and film.
This is the first comprehensive reference work to cover the international history of genocide and crimes against humanity (not only genocide or the Holocaust). Articles span the fields of history, film/drama, literature, law, psychology, sociology, and political science.
